quest.name: Stirring Up Trouble
journal: Y'shtola seems quite pleased with herself. But whether she has good or bad news to share remains to be seen.
objectives: Retrieve supplies from the outpost crates.
Use a smoke bomb on the beehive.
Use a large burlap sack to take bees from the beehive.
Use a smoke bomb on the beehive.
Use a large burlap sack to take bees from the beehive.
Give the buzzing burlap sacks to Y'shtola.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Hopefully Y'shtola has good news to share.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: A chance to reclaim the night has lit a fire in Minfilia that I would see kindled.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: What do you suppose she's gleaned from the tablet?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Let me begin by first explaining the origins of this tablet.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I initially believed it might detail the history of the Church of the First Light. Much to my surprise, it dates back to the end of the Ronkan Empire, and was likely written under the direction of the reigning ruler.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: It was a time of strife and unceasing war with neighboring nations. With each passing day they yielded more and more territory to their enemies.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: In their desperation, petitions for aid were sent out to their allies. This was one such petition.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: And you think this ancient petition will somehow help us get into Yx'Maja?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Indeed we do.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: For etched into this tablet is a method by which one may prove themself an ally of the Ronkan Empire.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Provided we are able to decipher said instructions, we may entreat the ruin's protectors to grant us safe passage.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The problem, however, is I presently lack the resources to decipher them in their entirety.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We have but one recourse: there exists a stone monument inscribed with ancient Ronkan text and translations into a more modern dialect which came into use after the fall of the empire. I am confident it will suit our purposes.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Where can we find this monument?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Here in Citia, quite close to Slitherbough, in fact.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The good news ends there, however, for it is in the possession of a rather radical faction of Dark worshipers─the Children of the Everlasting Dark.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If I am to study the monument, I must infiltrate their encampment.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I have no intention of taking longer than absolutely necessary, but I will nevertheless require time to transcribe the text I need. To ensure that I will have enough, I am afraid I must ask you and Thancred to assist me.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: And before you even ask, the answer is no. If we're to remain unseen, our group must be as small as possible.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: ...All right. I'll stay here until you return.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: We won't be long. If anything should happen, you keep her safe.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Then let us convene outside, to the west of Slitherbough where the path diverges.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Take care, Forename.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: For my part, I shall make all possible preparations that Y'shtola may begin translating the tablet upon her return.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: All set.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The encampment we seek is to the north, but it would be foolish to simply rush in.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: A guard has been posted at Cleric to keep watch over the Children. Perhaps he has aught to share of their recent activity.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: But we must tread carefully. There is a chance we may encounter them along the way.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Stay close and stay alert. I would avoid a confrontation if possible.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: They rejoice in dealing death to others, claiming that in doing so they cleanse their victims of sin and usher them unto the sunless sea. I would rather not sully my hands defending myself against such madmen.

dialogue.name: WATCHER03329
dialogue.text: Ahhh!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Do not interfere with our work!

dialogue.name: WATCHER03329
dialogue.text: By the blessed Dark...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Thank goodness you are unharmed.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: We would have arrived sooner, but we too had a rather unwelcome visit from the Children.

dialogue.name: WATCHER03329
dialogue.text: You are an acquaintance of Master Matoya, then. My apologies.

dialogue.name: WATCHER03329
dialogue.text: The Children have been acting strange of late, so I thought to take a closer look. I was careless...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Strange? What have you seen?

dialogue.name: WATCHER03329
dialogue.text: At first there seemed to be nothing out of the ordinary─the usual gathering of ingredients for poisons from flora and fauna.

dialogue.name: WATCHER03329
dialogue.text: But then I took notice of their venomous spiders. They've been breeding them in much greater numbers.

dialogue.name: WATCHER03329
dialogue.text: It's as if they're preparing for something...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Any ideas as to what?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: It could be anything, really. If it meant the end of the Blessed, nothing would be too cruel or violent for them.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: But perhaps we can use their present preoccupation with spiders to our advantage.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If we were to introduce a threat to the nests where they keep them, the Children would be compelled to save them. Bees, for example, are a natural predator of spiders.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Set them loose on the nests and we would have our opportunity to sneak into their encampment.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: What a mischievous plan. I like it. With a bit of smoke we should be able to subdue a few colonies long enough to secure their hives.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Have you anything we might be able to use?

dialogue.name: WATCHER03329
dialogue.text: We should have smoke bombs at the outpost just over there.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Then it's settled.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Grab a few smoke bombs from the outpost and search about for beehives.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I imagine the bees won't take too kindly to your visit, but once they're knocked out, take the beehives and bring them back here. Two will suffice, I should think.

dialogue.name: WATCHER03329
dialogue.text: If it's all the same to you, I'll be returning to Slitherbough. I don't want to get in the way. Stay safe, and may the shadows keep you.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The bees begin to swarm!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Were you able to find any?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The guard returned to Slitherbough, but not before offering his thanks.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: As for the beehives, Thancred and I were successful in acquiring what we need. How did you fare?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: This is more than enough. The Children are certain to be displeased.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Let us hurry, before the bees begin to stir.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I have no doubt thou wilt find the contents of the tablet most informative.
